review_title: good place to work and build a life

pros:
-Insurance is nice 
-Can take a limited number of classes for free
cons:
The university has been in a downward spiral for the last several years and has yet to really find its footing. The number of registered students is lower and lower every year and the state gives out money based on graduation rates. This has resulted in compounding issues where nobody wants to work here due to the awful pay so quality employees cycle out to greener pastures. Constant attempts to balance the budget just result in both the work and student experience deteriorating, thus just exasperating the issue. 
-Awful base pay
-Minimal chances for raises

pros: Love the work, it's a fun environment

pros: Your colleagues will be the best part of working here.  Students run the range from amazing to should not be in college, just like other schools out there.  Staff are great.  Quality education at a reasonable price.
cons: Pay is on the low end.  Worst part is the faculty are not valued.  You will get different answers from the same administrator depending on who asks.  Communication is gone.  Bring a problem forward, at best you get a task force but no solutions.  The number of Professors has been dwindling for years.

pros: Great great business with customer service and keep the grounds maintenance up for the college and put his students that attend in the people that come to camp to enjoy the campus ball games and high school events grade School events as well as political events different stages of cleaning up and mowing grass and planting flowers and doing the duties to keep their grownds and helping the public out around campus and other people that need help that work there
cons: I been there 28 years I have not really send any cons that didn't get look at and straighten out in timely manner I enjoy my job there and people I work with it's really hard find negative cause Im happy there.

review_title: Overall a good place to work.
pros: Great benefits (e.g health, retirement, tuition, vacation - the typical things you find in a university), wonderful group of people in my department, the best supervisor I've had, encouraged by my supervisor to take time to expand my knowledge/skill set to better not only myself but doing my job better
cons: Pay slightly lower than private sector, a lot of variability from one department to the next in how things are run (a lot of departmental politics), some supervisors limit the work they allow employees under them to do which doesn't encourage growth

review_title: I loved my job at the University of Southern Indiana because I liked working with the students and helping them.
pros:
I learned a lot from working here.
I loved the diversity of the students.
I felt satisfied when helping students who needed help.
cons:
Although I loved my job, they don't pay too well.
They don't promote from within too much.

review_title: University of Southern Indiana Financial Aid Office student worker
pros: Students could easily work during the school semester while attending class. If there was down time in the financial aid office, homework could be completed regularly.
cons: There were multiple times that many letters/forms had to be sent out. This was one of the least favorite activities that the office required.

review_title: Lovely Benefits, Great Culture, Terrible Pay for Hourly Staff
job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Evansville, IN
pros: Culture, environment, benefits package, health care, safe clean campus, great team.
cons: Truly my only problem is the unfairly low wages that hourly staff receive.

review_title: There is a sense of overwhelm and apathy that keeps the machine moving very slowly.
pros: Excellent benefits. Nice people. Good ideas.
cons: People don't seem to be excited about their work. There is a lot of discussion and committee work regarding change, but it doesn't seem to impact the individual employee positively. Great ideas seem to get watered down.

review_title: My experience working for the University of Southern Indiana was enjoyable and fulfilling.
pros: One of the best reasons to work at the University of Southern Indiana is the opportunity to work with a diverse staff as well as getting to network with many people.
cons: One of the downsides to working at the University of Southern Indiana is the inconsistency when it comes to how different housing staffs operate.

review_title: Faculty Treated as Peons; Forget any Work/Life Balance
pros: Many good folk--highly talented and personable--pass through the faculty and student ranks. Lots of money being poured into dressing up the campus, which is, indeed, a beautiful place.
cons: If you really want to be a creative and innovative teacher and researcher, go somewhere else--you will work yourself to death at USI, and they'll toss you by the wayside when you're all used up. Only the administrators make good salaries, and the current provost is a horror--he makes no secret of the fact that faculty are worth nothing to him, and he has all the deans, chairs, and directors so terrified of his temper tantrums they won't make a move without his say so. (For example, if they dare to make a decision on their own--even when the faculty handbook supports their right to do so--the provost has a fit). Just be sure that you don't have any family to care for or, god forbid, a physical ailment that makes it difficult for you to fulfill the hefty workload (i.e., not only a 4/4 course load, but also expect to participate in several committee projects while maintaining the kind of research expected at a 3/3 course load institution): if so, they'll squeeze you out as soon as they can, no matter how much of your life you had poured into the place and its students. Expect to be treated as a criminal if you dare speak up and request some assistance, and don't make the mistake of thinking that the human resources department is anything but a mouthpiece for the provost.

pros: The people are extremely nice and the atmosphere is very stress free. They are very flexible with my class schedule as well.
cons: The only downside to working in the library is that the day to say work does not change very much.

pros:
Fellow staff and students are a pleasure to work with.

pros: Excellent retirement benefits, employee fee waiver for undergraduate and graduate level courses, dependent fee waiver (75%), childcare, fitness center..

review_title: USI it's about the benefits more than the money!

cons: Raises are minimal unless you are at the VP level.  Raises for administrative staff is equal to a tank of gas whereas the VPs' raises are equal to a new car.
